channel.title: Best Sprint Phone
channel.description:
Basically I'm going in the store later today after work to get a new phone. I've had the rumor since the day it came out and it's been freaking out lately. I have like around a $200 credit towards a phone and if it's any more than that I pay the difference.
I'm looking for something tight. Maybe free 3G internet? Or free Wi-Fi access? Easy to text on. Any suggestions besides a different carrier? I don't really have time to look good phones up.
Oh, and custom ringtones would be awesome. Not some weird way like uploading them somewhere and downloading to a phone. Like transferring it directly to the phone and setting it.

item.title: Best Sprint Phone
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I already chose my phone and it’s really simple and all I’d use it for is SMS and calls, which works out because almost everything I wanted in the other phone I have in this iTouch.

I pretty much found all the answers myself, and how to delete things. I also got those two, but now I’m pretty much using installous instead of cydia.

My only other question is about installous. When I download a game it takes me to the status bar page. If I leave that page and download other games, I’m pretty sure it’s still downloading. How to I get back to that. If I download another game it’s a separate page with that games download bar. If I go to the downloads page it shows the things I’m downloading/downloaded. However it doesn’t say if they’re done or not. If I try to install one that isn’t done it says it can’t uncompress the archive. So I’ve got backgrounder and I just leave it on the status page and put it in the background and play some games.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Sprint Phone
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

respring it, if that doesn’t fix it, you can ssh it and delete the apps from the springboard. If you hold your finger on the app you want to delete for like 4 seconds, and release a bunch of red x’s will appear on all the apps installed from app store. That’s another way to delete them. As for apps from cydia, you’ll need to get cydelete to delete those from springboard.

just go to the search page in cydia, and search for like “all sources” or something like that. A couple repo’s you definitely need to get: xSellize, hackulo.us They are like my two favorite repo’s.

As for getting a smartphone, you can get the phone, then after like the first month just turn the plan off. If you get a phone with wifi you’re pretty much set.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Sprint Phone
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Actually that might have been the Palm I was looking at, it was the newest one and the other one I said might be the name of my girlfriend’s old Palm.

But apparently you HAVE to have a media plan to get it, so we’d have to change our plan which I’m not doing.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 26, 2009, 12:38:23 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Elijah, post:8, topic:304232”]jailbreak it, cydia, and the all repositories package, and you’re set for life.[/quote]

What is this all repositories package and where can I get it. I noticed a bunch of repository packages in the respective section, but most of them were for other languages and such. I’ve found a site with a list of lots, but I’d hate to type each one in.

Another question. My mom had some apps and music on here and I synced it to my computer telling it to remove all the ones on there (not restoring it because that would give me firmware 3.1.1 which I don’t want). Well it said they’re removed but all the icons are still there and if I click them it loads the app for a half a second and goes back to the spring board. Some of these apps I kinda want now and if I try to install them via the app store it says already installed.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Sprint Phone
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Eh I checked that out.

I would’ve liked the HTC something or the Palm Treo Center or some shit like that, but the chick was like you can’t because you have to change your plan. Apparently even though I wouldn’t go on the internet, it’s required to have internet with that phone. So my options were severely limited and I went with this one music kinda phone which was free. So far I like it. I have very basic uses for a phone considering my mom just gave me her iTouch.

Anyone know much about them? Any good sites to download “free” apps I’ve seen HUGE bundles of them but I’d really only want a few.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Sprint Phone
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Maybe you’d like the instinct. My friend has had it for a year and a half, dropped it many times, little scratches and it’s very durable.

Very easy texting, good touch phone, 3g, wireless, sprint tv, gps, can hold music (micro sd card for it).

If you are renewing or starting a new contract, damn it’s worth $100. If not, well you get a $100 mail in rebate

Read full topic
